author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Sorcerer Spell List - What is your ideal spell list, from Epic Spells/Lvl 9 to Lvl 1?

Hey ECB Guild Members

I thought I would start this thread because it is interesting, and related to building, and Mick has been kind enough to share with me his lvl 8 spell list along with a few other choices he makes.

Sorcerers have an incredible number of spells / day but have a limited spell selection.
However for an experienced player this is ok, because we tend to develop favorite spells, so to speak, and casting more of your favorites is very fun including with metamagic (silent/extend/still, empower, maximize). 
Any less commonly cast spells can always be cast from scrolls or wands, if they are available, although they will be dispellable.
There is also flexible spell casting to adjust strategies on the fly, along with not having to memorize spells in advance (just rest whenever, cast whatever) is really nice.

Anyway I will kick things off with a DC Spell List, I think this is a fun topic and can stimulate some debate :) 
I play PvM, so my spells are targeted at that, although it would be interesting to look at a PvP focused DC spell list too!

We can also have a no DC spell list too later, in case one is playing a Sorcerer Spellsword (such as Mick Dagger's Spellsword of Bahamut)!

(For those who are unaware, DC casting is when the primary casting stat (ie Charisma) is high, no DC casting is when the primary casting stat is low (ie Cha 19 or 20) to put in other features (such as ultra high strength on a spellsword, or ultra high constitution on an Arcane Tank) and focuses on spells without DC saves. 

Orion's Sorcerer DC Spell List

Epic Spells: Epic Mage Armor, Epic Warding, (Greater Ruin if I have space to deal with the Dreaded Demi-Lich, thanks for the advice Web!)

Level 9 (3 choices): Time Stop, Mordenkainen's Disjunction, Wail of the Banshee

Level 8 (3 choices): Horrid Wilting, Sunburst, Greater Sanctuary (or Summon VIII for Animal Domain sorcerer builds)

Level 7 (3 choices): Shadow Shield, Bigby's Grasping Hand, Finger of Death

Level 6 (3 choices): Issac's Greater Missile Storm, Bigby's Forceful Hand, True Seeing (or Mass Haste for Speed Caster builds)

Level 5 (4 choices): Firebrand, Hold Monster, Lesser Mind Blank, Mestil's Acid Sheath or Lesser Spell Mantle

Level 4 (4 choices): Improved Invisibility, Ice Storm, Lesser Spell Breach, Fear, (or Elemental Shield for Damage Shield builds)

Level 3 (5 choices): Haste, Flame Arrow, Stinking Cloud, Negative Energy Burst (or Prot v Elements depending if scrolls/wands are available)

Level 2 (5 choices): Darkness, Ultravision, Endurance, Flame Weapon, Bull's Strength (or Death Armor for Damage Shield builds)

Level 1 (5 choices): Prot v Alignment, Color Spray, Mage Armor, Grease, Magic Missile (or Expeditious Retreat for Speed Caster builds)

I dont build for PvP, but just curious how useful mantles are given a Time Stop -> Mord or a UMD user with a wand of LSB can just blow it off without failure

I like Bigby's 7 better than Bigby's 9 for knockdown immunes, it frees up a level 9 spell for another Max IGMS or Time Stop, I think the grapple effect and paralysis effect is the same, I can use some of the 8 spell slots for silent Bigby's 7 too in an emergency (but I do want to save em for emp IGMS Sunburst or Wilting) 
However I can see how 2d6+12 damage/round over up to 40 rounds could be very substantial if there is no damage soak or greater brawlers belt av 760 damage over 40 rounds wow!
Haste Time Stop Bigby's 9 ext Evard's and slowly bludgeon em to death over 40 rounds! :) Enough time to make a coffee and sandwich to get the energy up for the next encounter :) Think it would work for Mephistopheles ?

Actually I had one other thought - Flesh to Stone.
This is a pretty powerful ability, and I have seen MrZork cast it pretty effectively in a party with his wizard.
Maybe level 6 could be IGMS, Bigby 6 and Flesh to Stone for non-speed casters, and True Seeing can be obtained from scrolls or items? :)
Just a thought. Put it on some nasty low fort enemy mage or rogue.

No right or wrong here btw, I think we can all learn from each other :)

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content: Does the Spellcraft bonus to saving throws against spells help against a Flesh to Stone spell? It technically has a duration, which is permanent.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Does the Spellcraft bonus to saving throws against spells help against a Flesh to Stone spell?
Flesh to Stone has a Fort save to avoid being Petrified, so yes.

The Permanent duration is due to the Difficulty level on the PW
Under the "Normal" and easier difficulty settings, the petrification lasts one round per caster level when the target is a player character. Under the harder settings, and always for non-player characters, the petrification is permanent (although, as usual, all spell effects are removed when the caster rests).

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content:
My spell list has evolved… (see previous post, edited)

I just realized how useless EBT could become in epic-level PvP (provided the default script). According to NWNWiki,

“The grapple check used to determine whether or not a tentacle hits a target is as follows:
1d20 + caster level (to a maximum of 20) + 4(tentacle's strength modifier) + 4(tentacle's size modifier) versus
1d20 + base attack bonus + strength modifier + size modifier.”

"…Due to a bug in the script, a medium-sized target gets a +8 bonus, as if he were of huge size.”

From what I understood, against the spell’s most vulnerable target (e.g lvl 40 mage), the most I could expect is a dismal 50% effectiveness.

So I decided to drop both EBT and ILMS. Lesser Spell Breach is retained for option to conserve Mord’s. I also chose Elemental Shield (50% fire/cold immunity, could be activated at the same time as Energy Buffer) to fill up the lvl 4 spell slot.
